name: analysable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
possible to analyse (= study or examine in detail, or explain): We had difficulty obtaining recordings of high enough technical quality to be analysable. The argument contains a number of separately analysable elements.
More examplesFewer examplesFor some patients in the study, it was not possible to generate an analysable DNA histogram. We are not living in a world where all results are analysable and and all risk measurable.In 54% of cases analysable chromosomes were obtained.These words are analysable from a purely linguistic standpoint but their actual meaning does not correspond to that which is suggested by analysis.
